definitions.definition: of a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone:
having a pale face because you are not well, or you are feeling shocked:
examples: She was white, and her lips were pale.

definitions.definition: used in the names of various food and drink products, many of which are not pure white but slightly cream, yellow, grey, or transparent:
a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone:
examples: In some countries it is traditional for a bride to wear white.

definitions.definition: white clothes, either worn for a particular activity or job, or put together to be washed at the same time:
the part of the eye that is white:
examples: Don't shoot until you see the whites of their eyes (= until the people are very close to you).

definitions.definition: the transparent part of an egg that surrounds the yolk and becomes white when cooked:
examples: Beat four egg whites into stiff peaks.
